this comes out of my estrostep fe package - 'Missed mestrual periods for both dosage regimens At times there may be no mestrual period after a cycle of pills. Therefore, if you miss one mestrual period but have taken the pills exactly as you were supposed to, continue as usual into the next cycle.' So thats it then... I'm fine :)

i went to a friends house yesterday and took a pregnancy test - fortunatly it came up negative. But I still havent started. I will prolly make an appt with my Dr in the next few weeks for a blood test. Maybe my estrogen levels are too low or something. I dont know. Mike thinks it my tae bo. He was releived to hear that I came up negative too. But he seemed a little more at ease about the whole baby thing then last time this happened to me. I guess its because he is older. That was like 4 years ago. Last night I went to urlLink Lynch's Irish Pub for a few beers with some old friends from my previous job. It was a lot of fun. urlLink Little Green Men was there. Great 80s cover band. Today is my dad's 52nd birthday. He has already made plans so I dont get to take him out or anything. I dont have any money to do that anyway. I'll be sure to give the house a call around 6 or so to say Happy Birthday. I'll take him out next weekend or something.

lunch break time - im not eating anything though, i had a muffin for breakfast and I'm leaving here at 1:30 anyway so I'll eat something at home. I dont know what to do this afternoon. Maybe I'll go down to the pool and relax. Hopefully relaxing this afternoon will bring upon what every girl expects every month. blah - I only have 2 more days left before I am spozed to start another pack of pills. i take those damn things at the exact same time every frikken morning - never ever missed one. If they failed me.. i'm going to be pretty upset. If they didnt.. I'm just going to stop having sex so I dont have to think about it anymore.

well.. i went to my car... frikken gates are timed.. so my badge didnt work to open them :( suck ass - now i have to get Mike to bring me to work in the morning - im sure he wont be too happy about that.. but what can ya do Im going to wait until he gets home for me to tell him - i think i bothered him at work too much today

urlLink Quiz: What kind of lover are you? Tender Doe You value intimacy and you prefer that it remain private. You will never be caught red-handed flirting intensively; it just isn't your style. On the other hand, you have a quality that's really appreciated by the opposite sex: you are a faithful and devoted lover and you tend to build up an ideal image of your man. Still, you're not really a sexual beast, as you're able to contain sensual drives. You don't much like taking sexual initiatives, and the soft caresses of foreplay are always your favourite moments of love-making. When it comes to sex itself, you're very much a traditionalist. You're not inclined towards experimentation—whether it involves watching erotic films or trying out new positions—and you're not likely to make a huge amount of noise either. Yet, this doesn't mean that you don't enjoy sex or that you're incapable of feeling pleasure. For you, it's more about the emotions than it is the physical sensations.

I am such a mess. I have been so upset and depressed this evening its driving me crazy. I guess it started when Mike called me from work this evening asking me about a house we had been looking at. I told him that I dont think that we are ready to buy a house. And he said that he wasnt talking about "we" he was talking about either him or I buying it. And I guess that just hurt me. So I told him to do what he wants... I dont plan on buying a house alone. I cant afford that. I cant afford anything. Now I have my Med Lab teacher trying to get me to take a class in the fall. But if I take one of her classes I have to drop another that I am already signed up for. She says she would like me to take at least one med lab class a term so she can "keep tabs on me". I guess I feel like I will hurt her feelings if I tell her no.. or even when I do the switch to nursing. I am having lunch with Jeanne tomorrow. Its going to be nice to hang out with her again. I havent seen her since July 4th. But somehow in my day tomorrow after lunch, I have to go to my parents house, go to school, and go grocery shopping. (With what money) Ha! Its transfer funds out of the ole savings account day. then most of my next paycheck goes to paying myself back with interest. Doesnt make too much sense does it. I always end up taking it back out. So I'm not doing my tae bo again tonight. I'm just too sad. I was spozed to lose so much weight doing this too. To me I look the same. A scale said I lost 10lbs. that was a few weeks ago. I think i have gained it all back. Whatever. I'm over it.

I was just reading over some of my parisitology notes that my teacher puts up on the web. She says: "Several years ago, I went on a cruise to Cozumel and Cancun. The couple that were at my table on the ship decided to eat while they were ashore - they had nachos at a resturant that the ship had said was safe. Two months later, the woman became paralyzed on one side - they did imaging studies and found cysticercus in her brain. They administered Praziquantel and also steroids because when the larva dies, it creates massive inflammation. She recovered fully but was in the hospital about a month - the paralysis took longer to resolve. She missed 4 months of work. Sanitation in Cozumel and Cancun is terrible and this is a very common problem. If you visit there be very carefuk about eating and drinking ashore." I will have to keep that in mind.

Ya know, its cool and all that they are doing the rememberences of Sept 11 2001 today. I mean, its the one year anniversary. I was listening to WBS in Atlanta for coverage and a chick here had on either the radio or a TV for the coverage. After 9am, I turned it off. But Mary still had hers going. They were in the middle of reading the names of those who died when a lady came on and read a little thing about her dad who worked at the World Trade Center. It was so sad. It made me start thinking about all those families who got messages on their answering machine from their loved ones shortly before they died. I wonder if they kept those messages just so they can hear their loved one's voice again. It just kills me. I can't stop getting all emotional about it. Blah. Today will be a long day. I'm sure Psychology class will be all about this junk tonight. I just want to go back to bed.

The Friday Five 1. Would you say that you're good at keeping in touch with people? yeah, the people I choose to stay in touch with, I usually do 2. Which communication method do you usually prefer/use: e-mail, telephone, snail mail, blog comments, or meeting in person? Why? E-mail - its fast, easy and available all day 3. Do you have an instant messenger program? How many? Why/why not? How often do you use it? I use AOL Instant Messenger. Thats the only one. I use it because I once had an AOL account so I can keep my screenname. 4. Do most of your close friends live nearby or far away? They all live about 15 mins away. I live in the middle of everything. :) 5. Are you an "out of sight, out of mind" person, or do you believe that "distance makes the heart grow fonder"? hmmm... I would say most of the time its "out of sight, out of mind" but I have been known to follow "distance makes the heart grow fonder"

i had a dream that i was in some department store. Feels like urlLink Target . I was looking at remote controlled cars. I was wanting to buy one because last time I was in there it was only $30 but when the lady rang it up, it was like $150. I know this connects with my great deals I got at KMart last weekend. Most of the dream was spent trying to figure out how to get this remote controlled car for $30. i remember as i was speaking with the manager about it, my friend Miguel (whom I havent seen in real life in almost 2 years) shows up. But I am too consumed with this car that I tell him to hold on. I send Mike to get Miguels phone number but for some reason it never happens. I hate frustrating dreams like that. My brain was picking out some crazy brain cells. Thats the biological view on dreams. Called the activation-synthesis hypothesis. It says that dreams are a by-product of random stimulation of brain cells and have no direct psychological meaning. People just like to think they do. That dreams are some porthole into the subconscious. Who knows. Last night, Mike and I made margaritas and ate urlLink Subway . ugh i frikken hate cockroaches. they scare the crap out of me. i was going into the laundry room to throw away some left over tator tots - and something black moved in the garbage can. It caused me to drop 3 tator tots. I tossed the ones that I had left in my hand into the garbage can then grabbed the RAID. I sprayed it into the garbage can and came into the bedroom. I thought about taking the garbage out for a while... so I put on my sandals. Still not knowing how I was going to overcome this quick black thing that moved in the garbage can. So I opened the door to the laundry room and stood there for a moment... listening. I could hear something... but I couldnt place what or where it was. I then grabbed the phone to call my sister. I asked her why she couldnt live next door so she could take care of things like thjs for me. I kept her on the phone for support as I grabbed the broom. I planned on poking the garbage can to see if anything would come out. Instead I decide to sweep up the kitchen some.... turn around... and on the floor about 2 feet away is a huge ass cockroach. I scream and cry while my sister is telling me to calm down and that everything would be alright. This thing is like 2 inches long! Thank god he was on his back and dieing. But.. he was still RIGHT THERE. I cant go back in there. Not until he is totally dead. Mike is going to have to take the garbarge out too. I can't even pick those things up where they are dead. I have to sweep them out the front door. There is one still one the stairs that was in the bathroom. I swept one that was in the kitchen under the washing machine. I'll deal with him when we move. There is still one smooshed in the bedroom carpet from months ago. Gross huh? There was one that I watched die sitting right here the other night. I dont know where he went. Mike wont tell me if he picked him up er not. I still feel all uneasy and scared from dealing with that monster bug in the kitchen. All of these cockroaches showing up uninvited sure isnt helping my fear of them. One.. once in a while.. I can sort of handle. But.. this has been like at least one a day. At they come out of no where and startle me. Which just makes it worse. ugh. I need a hug.

What a frikken cool ass day today has been! For the past month, my managers have been saying that we have a huge ass project to do today. No one was allowed to take the day off. One chick had to come today who was on vacation. We had to work late last night and come in early today so we could get our crap done to do this "project". They even got our lunch orders last week since we would be unable to take a lunch. I was planning on getting a crispy chicken salad from the Loop. So, today I get here at 7am. I had a meeting from 8am-10am. Came back to my dept and got some more work done. At around 10:30 my manager Marlene comes out and tells us to log off our computers. She said we were part of a fire drill practice. They wanted to see how long it would take us to get out of the building. She said we would get into a school bus downstairs - go to the downtown branch - head to the 2nd floor where she would do a head count. So we all grab our junk and head out the door. 1st odd thing was that we were taking the elevators. She was pushing us for time and we all thought the stairs would be faster. Instead all of Automated Services AND Accounting got into one elevator. Sure enough, downstairs was a school bus. We got on the bus and headed towards the downtown branch. The guy driving the bus... missed the branch. He went right past it. We were all yelling about him missing it and made jokes about how we were going to the Avenues mall instead. I was expecting him to turn around and go back to the branch. Instead he went over the Main st bridge and we ended up in the Charthouse parking lot. Confused and excited - we all got off the bus. Awaiting us at the dock was the Lady St. Johns. We spent the afternoon cruising the St. Johns River enjoying a catered lunch and the wonderful weather. It was a wonderful surprise. It was a reconstruction celebration that we were spozed to have a long time ago but we all forgot about it. Our managers did a great job planning this. We all had no idea! When we came back to work, on our desks there was a rose on top of a gift and a card. The card was a personalized thank you from Marlene and the gift is a nice notebook that has T.E.A.M embossed on it and a picture of some doods taking on some rapids. Then Accounting started singing happy birthday to Gary and came over here with some birthday cake. Its just been a cool day. Even though I didnt get my Loop chicken salad.

Well, I went to the dermatologist this morning. The visit cost me $25. I have urlLink Seborrheic Dermatitis . He wrote me 3 prescriptions to minimize the issue. But its something that will never go away. He also "froze" a wart that has shown up on my hand. Today was the first time I have used ECCU's health insurance. Man.. does it suck. It cost me $40 for this foam junk I have to rub in my scalp and $10 for some face lotion. I haven't filled the shampoo prescription yet. But, whatever. Its still cheaper than if I didnt have any insurance.

This weekend was kinda neat-o. Friday night we had dinner at a new resturant around here called urlLink o'charleys . It was a big disappointment. We were expecting corned beef and Guinness but instead we got blackened steak and Amberbock. Mike's "blackened" steak was 1/4in thick, half fat and not spicy in the least. My steak and shrimp combo was alright. The veggies were undercooked. This place sure isn't like Outback. Saturday morning we went to the stadium for the Jaguar sendoff tailgate party. It was put on by the Booster Club who provided free hotdogs and cokes. It was kinda lame cause everyone there was all old and cheesy. There was this poor old woman there who musta been at least 80 years old with a walker. We kept thinking she was going to die when she was crossing the parking lot. Hopefully more people will show up next time. It was cool seeing the players go to practice, come back, then leave in their SUVs all pimped out. Maybe hardcore football fans like Ted or season ticket holders like Jeanne and Jerry will consider supporting their team and the tailgate party will be just that. A par-tay. Its a good idea. Just more people need to do it. Saturday afternoon we went to the IMax theatre at the World Golf Village and saw Destiny in Space. It was a stunning narrative featuring the vocal talents of Leonard Nimoy. The IMax camera takes us on an adventure aboard the space shuttle to repair the Hubble Telescope and into the depths of space. We really enjoyed it. Saturday evening we spent almost 4 hours looking for a big ass wine glass to drink cocktails out of. We tried Target...but they had nothing. So we tried Regency Mall next. Surely the mall would have what we were looking for. An old black woman working at Belk almost passed out when we told her what we wanted. At about 10 til 9 we headed over to Garden Ridge. Sure enough, they had the exact glassware we were looking for. Unfortunatly, we spent 25 mins in line waiting to check out. We had this crazy lady behind us who would not stop making comments about how long the wait was. Finally, we were able to make our way to ABC liquors and buy more margarita mix. We both enjoyed big ass margaritas for the rest of the night. Sunday was peaceful. I spent some time in the morning cleaning up the kitchen. Then I headed to Publix to do my shopping. The rest of the day.. well.. not much went on. I did some homework, watched the Jag game, took a bath, watched the Sopranos and wrote this blog. Tomorrow I go to the dermatologist. I hope he can fix my skin. Soon. I also have two tests this week and have to work all day Saturday. I wont be able to make the Jaguar send off. :( Damn ECCU. I'm sure I have some jacked up spelling in here. But give me a break.. I have no spell check. :)

urlLink Edvard Munch: The Scream I have this painting in my bedroom. I always thought that it was popular. I called my Dad last night to find out what was up with my Mother. He said that he didn't know and didn't care. He wasn't going to call Flagler to find out. He talked more about getting a divorce and said how he hated to put this on us during the holidays. I asked him about Thanksgiving being cancelled. He said that it wasnt and he would take care of the cooking. I asked why it was cancelled anyway and he said because he wouldn't take my mom to the grocery store. So she got pissed. She has been drinking again. She knows it will kill her so obviously she doesn't care. My Dad is at the point now to where he doesn't care either. Some of his meds need to be refilled but he isnt going to bother. I am really not looking forward to this holiday season. Who knows if Mom will be home. If she is.. there will only be fighting. Christmas.. I'd rather just pass on it this year.

Always with the drama... Mom called on Friday and cancelled Thanksgiving. No reason as to why.. its just cancelled. So whatever.. thats fine. Well, yesterday my sister calls me to let me know that Mom has taken off. All the Thanksgiving decorations are missing and from what we understand Mom admitted herself to the psycho ward at Flagler Hospital. She left a note saying she was going to Flagler and not to call. She is such a baby. My sister said, the whole reason thanksgiving was cancelled is because Dad wouldn't take my mother to the grocery store to do the thanksgiving shopping. He felt it was too early. I had a scare with my siamese fighting fish yesterday morning. I always feed him before I leave. I could see him down in the corner of the tank. I put his food in the tank and he didnt move. Strange, he usually is swimming around this time of morning. I tapped on the glass and he still didnt start moving. I was getting kind of nervous. I turned on the light to the living room as well as his tank and still no movement. I tapped for a little while longer. He would jerk. I noticed his gills werent moving or his fins... eyes.. nothing. I accepted the fact that my fish was prolly dieing. I was sad about it. Giving up, I tapped the glass on last time and he started swimming around. Ate his food and flared at me. YaY! He was okay! Throughout the day at work though I worried about him. But sure enough.. he is just fine. I guess he was sleeping.
I am now a homeowner! And I am sick as crap so I can't enjoy it. Damn I just want to go home.

I need someone out there to tell me what is wrong with my Siamese Fighting Fish. He is losing some scales on his head. This is the 2nd time. The 1st time it healed up after I added some more stress reliever to the tank. I'm not sure if thats what fixed the problem or if it was just a coincidence. His back fin is also starting to split. My guess is fin rot. I will be heading to the pet store as soon as i can to get some medicine for that. I don't want to lose my little beta. :( He is my buddy.

Well, my fish has stopped losing his scales. But he is now suffering from tail rot. poor thing. my mom gave me some fish meds that should of made it better. It just made the water purple and foamy. Its been about a week now since i added the meds and his fins seems to have stopped "rotting". I cleaned half his tank today. i read somewhere that you should only clean it half at a time. I used the filtered water from the fridge. I would have used bottled water if I had some. I hope this water is better for him than straight from the tap. He seems okay so far.

We are spozed to have a test tonight but the professor was out all last week. I really don't think he will bust a test out on us. I need to get out of this department. Never before have me and this person acted that way towards each other. It was awful. Of course it was over something stupid. She ended up apologizing and we worked things out. We are all just tired and strung out. Thats prolly why my eyes have been twitching for the past 2 weeks.

Another weekend coming to a close. Didn't really do much of anything. Got some tea from urlLink Teavana on Saturday. Worked out at the beach branch that morning. Had a really bad rain storm. Oh and we went shopping for some new slacks for Mike. Everything was overpriced. Today I picked up the house some. The Suttons came to visit. It was nice to have some company over. After they left, I went to Lowes to look at paint and bought some rugs. The rugs aren't the greatest.. but for the price I couldnt say no.

"People are strange, when you're a stranger. Faces looks ugly when you're alone." For some reason I have that song in my head. I haven't heard it in years. I am waiting for Mike to call. He said he would call before he left BAM so I could get his dinner ready. Getting his dinner ready was actually my idea. I didn't want him wasting money at Wendys again after I bought all this food. Its 11:15pm and he still hasn't called. I guess they aren't letting him leave early. Just talking to his mother... she mentioned how she saw a streaker running down Monument road at about 8pm this evening. Anyone hear anything about that? I didn't go to the tanning salon like I usually do on Wednesdays and Fridays. Instead, I hung out with my friend Jenna and her children. She is getting ready to audition for the Jacksonville Jaguars cheerleaders. THE ROAR! :) I hope she makes it. Well, Mike just called. He will be another 20mins before they get out of there. So, I told him I can't wait that long and he has to make his own hotdog. A girl needs her beauty sleep ya know.

Just finished chatting with my friend Jamey about his engagement. He emailed me a pic of the ring. It is one hell of a ring! Very beautiful! I am so jealous! hehe Over the weekend I looked at some rings on Kay Jewelers web site. I found a nice 1/4ct princess cut ring that I liked. So, I pointed it out to Mike and told him to buy it for me. He just shook his head and laughed while walking out of the room. Well, at least he knows what I want. ;)

Another day, another quarter. Ya know, I spent $160 bucks at Publix tonight. We had NO FOOD! I bought a wine rack yesterday at Havertys. Its looks pretty nice. I am one piece of furniture closer to having a completed looking house. Next is my salt water aquarium. :) My friend Matt came over tonight to see the house. He hasnt been here since the day I closed. He liked our wall in the living room. Most people seem to like it. Which is nice. It makes a very bold statement I think.

I am working at the Mandarin Branch right now. Its not too busy. Actually there is a member in front of me right now talking about something and filling out her deposit slip. Anyway, I didnt get the training position. They hired some girl from the outside because she had been a teller sup for 7 years. If they knew they wanted someone with a lot of teller exp they should have not jerked me around like they did. I am not happy. Its busy now... 11:10am... time to get back to work.
I am now a proud owner of a 75gal salt water aquarium. :)

My heart doesnt seem to be getting any better. I thought that maybe it was acting up due to anxiety and stress of that training position. Its been a week since I was denied and my heart is still acting up. I have cut caffeine out of my diet for a week now. That doesnt seem to be the cause either. So.. I dunno. My heart "fluttered" twice early this morning while I was trying to sleep. Once at 12:57am and the other at 1:37am. Who knows how often it does it while I am actually asleep. Its strange, cause when I wake up I actually feel fine. But in about 10mins of being awake it starts to ache again. I am too young for heart issues. My house is starting to reek from the shrimp I have put in my aquarium. I dont know how long I can stand it. Maybe since it looks like bacteria is starting to cycle, I can take them out. The shrimp were those dark colored ones and now they are pink with this white "haze" on them. Its pretty funky. I was watching FOX news for the time that I was not asleep yesterday evening. I got tired of the war news after a while and tried switching the channel to Married by America. Woudnt you know FOX news was playing on that channel too! I couldnt get away from it. I dunno if it was the sat messing up or what. So, I just went back to sleep. I have been sleeping a lot this week. What a way to spend SPRING BREAK!

I went to the doctor on monday for my heart. For the past month now, I have been getting these heart palpatation things. He did an EKG and that came out fine. He said there are many possibilities as to what is causing this. He wants me to keep a log of when it happens and what I am doing when it does for the next 2 months. After that, if it continues, he will put me on a heart monitor for 24 hours or so to hopefully catch it in action. So, we'll see how that all goes. I put some damselfish in my aquarium on saturday since I had my salt levels correct. They are the hardiest fish and help start the nitrogen cycle. They were all dead by sunday afternoon. I got some sorry fish. My friend Scott says to just put some shrimp in there from the grocery store and let them rot. It does just as good of a job and I'm not wasting $25 every few days restocking the tank. I dont make that kind of money anyway! I plan on going to Publix today to buy some shrimp. I think today is the last day Saddam has before he needs to leaves Iraq. He already said that he isnt going anywhere. I've heard many different comments on the subject. Two that I like are "Saddam will be dead in 5 days. Either by someone on the inside, his own hand, or the United States." and another talking about how we should start the war about 15mins before the Academy Awards begin. That way the news channels will be busy covering the war, instead of the Saddam supporters. I wonder if those libreal jerks will "apologize" once we uncover all of Saddam's WOM. For some reason, I find that doubtful.

I know I haven't written in a while. Not too much going on I guess. My heart still acts funny. I log it like my doctor as asked. I haven't had any caffeine since I have been to the doctor. Sticking with Sprite or caffeine free Coke. We have a wedding to go to this evening at the Prime Osborne Convention Center. Its going to be nice. The guest list is about 500 people. I'll be lucky if I get to say my "congrats" to the bride and groom. There is also a "Support Our Troops" rally downtown this afternoon that we want to go to. I'm not sure if we are going though. We would have to drive downtown, drive back here to get ready for the wedding, then drive back downtown again. I didnt go to Spanish class yesterday. We were going to learn a latin dance. Honestly, I wasn't feeling it. So I went home and got to spend time with Mike instead. :) So, this war is getting kinda yucky. The Iraqi "leaders" are a bunch of evil jerkoffs and I can't wait until we get them. Peace will be here soon.

I think I have one fish left. One was dead this morning and another was swimming upside down. I guess I'll have to get some more this weekend. Maybe just a few more. They sell for like 3 for $10. Its not that bad.
Oh! And I bought 6 more damselfish yesterday. I am down to three. I guess it could be worse.

oh man - i was just about to freak out. I took off my badge and it hit my ear. At that moment I realized that one of my most favorite earrings was missing! Ahhhhhh! I looked on the floor and I couldn't see it. WHO KNOWS WHERE I LOST IT! Thank god it showed up upon closer examination. :)

Today has just been whacked out. This morning, I had to deal with a dead fish and a dying fish. The poor dying fish was stuck in the filtration system. I had to turn the junk off and scoop him out. Then he fell on the floor. I'm sure that didnt help his situation. So I looked at him some while he was in my hand. He was moving a little bit. But not thrashing around like you would expect. So, I put him back in the water and he didnt do much. Just floated all sideways down to the bottom and waved his fins some. Poor little guy. :( So then I leave for work. (I'll get this fish out when I get home tonight) I'm driving up Lee Rd and I see this dove in the middle of the road just sitting there. I'm starting to wonder if this damn bird is going to move. There is a car coming in the other lane so its going to be tough to get around it. The bird got up when I was about 4 feet away. She had a bunch of little birds follow her out of the street. But, left in the street was a little bird that I guess she had been sitting on. I guess she was trying to bring it back to life. I don't know. As I passed she went back out to the street with her little peepers and sat down again. It just broke my heart. :( Work wasnt much better. I took 30 phone calls today. I havent had 30 phone calls in about 4 months! I average about 15 a day. I only got a lot of calls because one girl was off the phone training. The ATMS were going nuts today. I had to place service calls like crazy. Tons of ATM research coming in. But now its 5:30 and I'm done with it all. I'm so good I scare myself. I don't know what to do with my evening. Its going to be light outside until about 7:30pm now I think. I do have some laundry to finish up. I want to go shopping but I really cant. Need to save money for that water softener we are getting. What do you think about this? I plan on calling out from work this monday and tuesday just to show my manager that the girl she thinks is so wonderful and smart and can do my job....really can't. Maybe I'm just bitter. She has been here since like October and now she is being training all over the department like she is going to be our new "work leader". Uhm.. yeah thanks for just skipping over me. Oh wait.. I dont kiss your ass.. I forget that sometimes. That always holds me back. It kept me from being a coach at AOL and its keeping me from progressing here. Maybe I should... nah... I just can't bring myself to do it. I need to be my own boss.
Man, I work with a bunch of crazy bitches. I need the frick out this place.

I can't wait for this week to be over and done with. I have to work Saturday and I just want to hurry up and start my weekend. The draft is Saturday and I wanted to go to the stadium to watch it. I should be home a little after 12 so I hope I don't miss the Jags 1st round pick. I think we are #8 so I prolly will miss out. Jenna came over last night and we watched Insomnia. It was okay. I thought that it would have been a little more intense than what it was. It was just a simple little murder mystery. I don't know what I am going to do tonight. I don't have class anymore on Tuesdays and Thursdays until May 5th. I might go to a softball game but I am kinda tired and I dont feel like chilling at the beach for 2 hours waiting for it to start.

My 6 Damsels are still kicking. It's been a lil over a week now. One of them keeps getting picked on so I dont know how much longer he has. We checked out the Nitrite levels and they are still increasing. I think in a few more weeks we should be set. We went to Atlantis Aquariums this weekend. That place is frikken awesome! We just bought a background. They wanted too much for the rocks so we went out to the North Jetties to look for some. Didnt find any, but brought home some hermit crabs for the tank. They seem to be doing good too. Nothing like free hermit crabs! :) Yesterday, we spent Easter with Jenna and her family. We swam in the pool and had dinner over there. The dinner was very yummy. She made this Sweet Potato delight that was amazing. I'm going to have to get the recipie for that! My parents seem to be pushing a wedding. My mom tells me that my dad has offered to pay for the music, location and food. I need to talk to him about that. My mom might have made that up, ya know?

I just got home from my very first BUNCO experience. It was quite fun! :) I am going again next month. All of the girls there were very nice. I was the oddball because I wasn't married nor did I have any children. So they got to talking about childbirth and crap while I just chilled in the back. I didnt win any of the prizes tonight. It seems that they way it works is that if you have an awesome night or a crappy night you win something. But if you just do okay than you leave empty handed. Cool thing is that I really didnt leave empty handed. This chick gets medicine samples sent to her house because a doctor used to live there so she brought those to share. Little trial sizes of childrens advil, robitussen and dimitapp. I know those are prolly spelled wrong. Im going to give the kid meds to my friend Rachel at work and keep the adult ones for myself. Also, the medicine lady brought back some special cadberry creme eggs from new zeland. They are flavors that are not here in the states. I got a Cadberry Dream Egg and a peppermint one. I havent tried either because I am waiting on Mike to get home. I think he went to the baseball game tonight. Jenna tried the dream egg and said it was yummy. Mike needs to get his butt home. He has a meeting in the morning and I need to go out to Jenna's in the morning to go to a community yard sale at The Woods. Its spozed to be the best yard sale thing in jacksonville. I wont be buying anything. I'm just going to support Jenna and her purchases. :) After shopping, I am going to try out my snorkeling gear than head off to see the XMEN. Going to be busy busy tomorrow! I'll be lucky if I see Mike at all. I know he doesnt want to go to The Woods but I'm not sure if he is going to come swimming. Thats why he needs to get his butt home so I can talk to him about this crap.

Well, I was right. I knew that black speck on my tooth wasnt pepper. Another cavity. My teeth suck. I brush at least two times a day and this still happens every time I go to the denitist. They said other than that cavity, I was doing a great job taking care of my gums and teeth and that I was one of her 'A' patients. I think I deserve a discount. I also made my dentist's day. She is a member at the credit union I work at. We got to talking about how the ATM machine she uses is always down and how far she has to drive to get there. I let her know about the CU24 network which allows her to make withdrawals and deposits at any credit union ATM. She was very excited about it and said that I just put a smile on her face. She couldnt wait to get home to tell her husband. I told her to write a letter but I doubt she will.

I get to leave work early today to go to the dentist. Trust me, I'd rather be at the dentist. I got written up yesterday. :( I took a non-negotiable check by accident while working an ATM bag. It was for about $320. They keep telling me not to make a big deal out of it. But to me, being written up is a big deal. And let me tell you this....this kiss ass in here.. lost $500 worth of checks....she hasnt been written up. ugh Anyway, I am looking forward to XMen this weekend. I'm going to make Mike take me whether he wants to or not. I have my first Bunco game tomorrow. And tomorrow we get our water softener. Wooo Hoo! Other than that... not too much going on. Just watching my credit card balance increase with frikken school.. I am really thinking about getting student loans. I think those will be better to have than credit card debt. But... I guess a debt is a debt. I hate being poor.

I left work early yesterday to head to Jenna's to get my hair done. I call her from Sally's Beauty Supply and she tells me that Angie (the baby)fell of the bed. So, I get to her house and that kid is screaming! It has to be the worst scream I have ever heard. It was awful. Jenna called the doctor and she advised that we take the baby to the emergency room to make sure everything was okay. Luckily enough, everything was okay. We only had an hour wait which wasnt so bad either. Jenna ended up starting my hair around 9:30pm and I got home at about midnight. My hair looks good though. I got some compliments on it today. :) I have my spanish exam tomorrow and next weeks starts summer term. Nice break huh? ...bunch jerks.... So, who wants to go out for margaritas tonight?

Yesterday I worked at the Mandarin branch. It was busy all morning. I had wanted to get out early because we had planned on going to the Jaguars Draft fan fest thing that was going on that the stadium. Of course, when you are in a hurry... you are out of balance. I didnt get out of there until 12:45pm. I hurried up and got home and started changing my clothes before I had the front door shut. Then Mike tells me that its okay and we were waiting on Cory anyway. Whew. So, we went to the stadium. Lots of interesting renovations going on. Its going to be neat when its al finished. We got to tour the Jags locker room which was kinda neat. After that we came home and I took a nap. While I snoozed, Mike grilled some steaks, tomotoes and zuchini. Its was a very yummy dinner. After dinner, we headed to El Apache resturant to meet up with a work get together for Mexican food and karaoke, The margaritas were gross. We had a few tacos that were okay. El Potro and La Napalara are a lot better than this place. So, since Mike has made dinner these past two nights, I made him some pancakes this morning. I think he was pretty happy about that. I was pretty happy because I didnt have to hear about how much he wanted pancakes again. It made for a peaceful morning. :) Today we are going to go looking for some snorkeling gear. Jenna and I are going to get scuba certified this summer. All I need to provide is the basic snorkeling gear and the cash to get certified. I've been saving for a while and I think I almost have a enough. After we go shopping, we might get a shrimp for the aquarium and maybe some live rock. But thats still up in the air. I think that if we got the live rock, its going to kill the damsels. But I guess thats okay, because I wasnt planning on keeping them anyway. I guess we'll have to wait and see when happens.

Ya know, I just have a real problem with plastic surgery. I guess in cases of facial reconstruction and stuff.. thats understandable. But because you think your lips are too thin or something lame like that.. I just don't agree with it. People getting bones removed from their waist to look like Barbie.. its just stupid. Its messing with the gene pool. "Ugly" people - making themselves "pretty" - reproduce and have children that looked just like how they looked before surgery! Whereas if they were too "ugly" to reproduce, more "ugly" people wouldn't be born into this world. Anyway, I just think its lame.

urlLink the friday five 1. Is your hair naturally curly, wavy, or straight? Long or short? Its always been straight and always will be. Even after I try to curl it. 2. I tried the 80s hair look, but I could never get it to stay. 3. How do your normally wear your hair? Parted in the middle and down. 4. If you could change your hair this minute, what would it look like? Longer with blue, green and white extenstions. 5. Ever had a hair disaster? What happened? Noah and I went out for drinks last night. It was really nice. He told a bunch of stories of what has been going on in his life. We talked some about the past. He brought back a lot of memories that I had forgotten. It was really really cool. He is still as beautiful as he was back then. He found it funny that I had a curfew. I told Mike that I was going out with Noah and he said how he was a little uncomfortable with it since Noah just kinda popped up. Mike would of rathered me bring along with someone else. But he said that I was grown and can do what I want. So, to make him feel better I told him a time that I would be home. 12am. That was only about an hour and 30 mins to go off and hang out. But anyway, I was good. So the night was over and he said he would give me a call. I told him the next time we hang out will have to be with Mike if he doesnt want me to have a curfew anymore. He said that was cool - gave me a hug and left. ::sigh:: It was great. He is just part of my past that I thought I had lost forever. Yesterday, I had a facial. It was awesome. I feel a ton better. Then afterwards I got some red, white and blue extensions put in. One set for each side of my head. I think they are cool. Mike thinks they are silly. But who cares. I like em! I cant wait for works reaction on Monday.

Holy friken crap! Noah...NOAH just stopped by my parents house. Noah! The one I fell all over myself for all through high school. He just called my cell. I got his number and said I would call him back. I only have 4 mins left on my phone and plus I am at work. But still....DAMN NOAH!! I just cant get over it. I guess I'll call him back after I get home tonight. Wow... Noah...

We just got into town about an hour ago. Drove the entire way home from Va. Took about 12 hours I guess. I was glad we did it in one shot. I just wanted to be home. The trip was okay. Today was my second day learning to Scuba Dive. I am beat. Ive lost like 3lbs since Friday. Swimming around in a pool for 4 1/2 hours will do that to ya. we just got back from vacation 2003. Our aquarium is messed up. a hose came loose and water sprayed out for who knows how long all over the floor and now the pumps dont work. i guess they burnt out. so first thing tomorrow we have to buy new pumps. there was a big ass spider near the front door and i have dead roaches all over the place. eh.. at least they are dead. lots of cleaning to do tomorrow too! So, my birthday came and went. I am 25 now. Yippie. Found out today that my grandfather passed that day. So, now my birthday sucks. Anyway, our vacation was pretty cool. We took a cruise to the bahamas with jenna and kenny. the 3 of us went scuba diving on the 23rd and saw 3 wrecks and a million sharks. it was really fun. after the bahamas, mike and i went to the keys. hung out in key west monday night and went scuba diving on tuesday in looe key. only saw 1 shark this time but a million barracuda. that night we drive up through alligator alley to punta gorda and spent the night there. That brings us to today and we went to Busch Gardens. did a few things there. I rode KUMBA by myself. Mike wasnt feeling it. It was a lot of fun. After that we drove to orlando to see my sister. we were spozed to spend the night there and go to sea world in the morning but we were just ready to come home. tired of living out of a suit case.

Well, that little bit turned into 5 hours. Now I have to go to bed tonight. I get 5 hours sleep usually in one night. Not as a nap! I guess that I am still tired.

So, my ultrasound came back positve for gallstones. My doctor doesnt know yet because he likes to close at noon on Fridays. The ultrasound lady said that i had a bunch. So we'll see what my doc says on Monday or whenever he decides to call me. I passed out at the movies last night watching the Matrix. I took a drink of my soda and I swallowed wrong causing my chest to hurt. usually that goes away pretty quick.. next thing I knew the screen was being swallowed by blackness and then I woke up with my popcorn on the floor, my hands kinda up against my chest and I was shaking. Jenna says it was just for a few seconds. Very weird. I didnt feel right the rest of the night. I feel okay this morning though. Anyway, I have to get my oil changed today. I have had this horrible pain that comes and goes in my side since Monday. I went to the doctor for it today since there was a chance that it could be serious. He poked at me and asked me a bunch of questions and thinks its my gallbladder. He wanted me to get an ultrasound today but I actually ate breakfast. So now I have to wait until Friday. Hopefully its just some stones that can be dissolved if anything. My mother had her gallbladder removed back in the day and my friend Mandy just had hers removed this year. Must be 2 decades between their surgerys and neither of them seemed to have too much fun recovering. Oh.. and my Bp was high. Its never been high. Getting old sucks.
I am having surgery on Wednesday - they will be removing my gallbladder. I'm not really looking forward to it. Doc says I should only be out a week. We'll see. I hope it is all worth it.

well, i had surgery on wednesday. Everything went well. My cuts are gross and they hurt but that will eventually stop. Well, I'm still sick as crap. Now I have a terrible cough and sore throat. Who whats to guess that its Strep! Dunno if I'll make it to the doctor. Our heater broke Friday night. I like how they updated the blogger website. Looks more user friendly. Anyway, a friend of mine said it was my turn to update. I have work to do but I can take some time out. Looking back....I funded my own wedding. Thanks alot America for helping me out. It was fun planning and I feel that I did a good job with the money that I had. I've heard good things (who would tell you to your face that your wedding sucked anyway) and everyone had a good time. The weather was great. A little windy.. but we weren't outside so it didnt matter. Married life isn't too different from the life I had before March 6th. We went to Ft. Lauderdale for 4 days for our "honeymoon" that was funded by my husbands employer. He had to go down there for business, so it worked out. We plan on taking a 7 day cruise for our 1 year anniversary. It leaves on March 6th, 2005 from P.C. I can't wait. I love cruising. I left ECCU in February and got a job at Vystar doing the same thing and making about 20 cents more. Yippie. The move was worth it though. The people are so much better. No more back stabbing bitches!! I dont have to sit in traffic as long either. I am still going to school. I got my AA degree in Decemeber and am registered at FCCJ as a "self-enrichment" student. I am currently taking a Human Growth and Development class. I need it for nursing if I ever get in. I will know before August if I made it. I have been looking into other choices just in case but nothing looks promising. Everything is offered during the day. I even went to Ultrasound Diagnostic..I think they are called Sanford Brown now.. but anyway they have a Surgical Tech program at night. They also want $18,000. hahahaha! I could understand $5000 even $6000 and would be willing to get a loan for that amount...but not $18000. I need a new car first. But to be able to afford that, I need a new job. Its like a catch-22 I guess. That part of life sucks right now. What else what else... Oh, my sister is moving in with us tomorrow. She is supposed to be living with us for about a year. I hope it lasts because she is the funding for the upcoming cruise! It will be strange having a roommate again, but we will get used to it. No more running around the house nekkid and stuff. I also want to move away. Especially to some place like South Florida or the Fl Keys. I just love it down there. It all way overpriced. I found a trailer in Key Largo for $150,000. Yes, I said trailer. Well, I guess thats a fairly decent update. Time to get back to work.

1,000 THINGS words & music by jason mraz 'I'm overjoyed and over loved and feeling lucky like a little boy who's hiding under covers and looking to discover any way to play the part inside his darkened cave well the meaning of life it starts at the nightlight close your eyes and hope to see mine well I've seen a thousand things in one place but I stopped my counting when I saw your face erasing memory I feel as though I've never seen a face before until I saw your eyes smiling back at me thru my tears I've been counting all these years Now suddenly the thousand things I've seen were nothing more than dreams of you and me you and me quietly at a stand still fortunately you will kiss me and I'll kiss you back fact of the matter of is that I don't know what the latter is that I always wanted to kiss you but I always wanted to run from you Because I always wanted to miss you And that I've always wanted to come for you So... how do you do?

So, I had Perfect Climate Heating and Air come out to the house yesterday to do a clean and check on my system. I know that it is 28 years old.. and yes I expected him to tell me that we needed a new system. He pointed out a bunch of things that were wrong. After he left, wouldn't you know the system ran and ran for four hours straight. We guess that the stress that he had to put on the system to test it was too much for it to handle. What luck! So, we are getting an entire new heating and air system installed tomorrow. $3195 - Mike had originally told me $3100 and thats all I asked to be financed. I am still trying to find out if there is going to be taxes on it. So, for all of you out there thinking about buying a house... go for it...if you have at least $20,000 in the bank after closing. sheesh

I leave work today at 3:15. Only 35 more minutes to go. I figure that I will waste it updating my blog. Why am I leaving early? I have an eye doctors appointment. I havent seen the eye doctor since I left AOL which was 2 years ago. Seems like a lot longer. Its all a distance memory. Things that went on come to me every once in a while and bring a smile to my face. I met a lot of really neat people there. The best times were when I was on the Techs 4 Evers team I believe. Yeah, I was stressed but I wasn't quite that bad yet. I could sit and listen to people all day and just watch the chat room. The Macintosh reps still only took Macintosh calls. Those were the days. Anyway, my sister has gotten my into reading Harry Potter. I started book one on Thursday and was done on Saturday. Started book two that same day and I will be done today. They are very good books. I hadn't seen any of the movies either so Saturday morning we watched the 1st one. When I finish the 2nd book, I will watch that movie and hopefully I will be done with the 3rd book before it leaves the theatre. :) Spent the weekend tearing up the bushes that were in front of the house. Now my hamstrings hurt. I think it looks better without all of the crappy bushes but Mike doesnt think so. We will plant something else there soon. Once the money tree decides to give me some more cash. Still have 25 mins to go. So, the crap overseas is getting worse everyday. This hostage crap is getting old. I feel bad for the families and for the person that did/will experience a horrible death. But you just can't negotiate with terrorists. Whos to say that they wont kill the person anyway if you meet their demands. It just shows them your weakness. I heard that poor Korean man crying how he didnt want to die on the radio this morning. Poor guy. But its not going to matter. I should check boortz.com to see if he has anything to say about it. That will tick some more time off the clock.
